Card.Name: Goblin Welder
Card.RulesText: {T}: Choose target artifact a player controls and target artifact card in that player's graveyard. If both targets are still legal as this ability resolves, that player simultaneously sacrifices the artifact and returns the artifact card to the battlefield.

Card.Name: Anger
Card.RulesText: Haste As long as Anger is in your graveyard and you control a Mountain, creatures you control have haste.

Card.Name: Copper Gnomes
Card.RulesText: {4}, Sacrifice Copper Gnomes: You may put an artifact card from your hand onto the battlefield.

Card.Name: Combustible Gearhulk
Card.RulesText: First strike When Combustible Gearhulk enters the battlefield, target opponent may have you draw three cards. If the player doesn't, you mill three cards, then Combustible Gearhulk deals damage to that player equal to the total mana value of those cards.

Card.Name: Sundering Titan
Card.RulesText: When Sundering Titan enters or leaves the battlefield, choose a land of each basic land type, then destroy those lands.

Card.Name: Platinum Emperion
Card.RulesText: Your life total can't change. (You can't gain or lose life. You can't pay any amount of life except 0.)

Card.Name: Inkwell Leviathan
Card.RulesText: Trample Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.) Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

Card.Name: Darksteel Colossus
Card.RulesText: Trample, indestructible If Darksteel Colossus would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, reveal Darksteel Colossus and shuffle it into its owner's library instead.

Card.Name: Shriekhorn
Card.RulesText: Shriekhorn enters the battlefield with three charge counters on it. {T}, Remove a charge counter from Shriekhorn: Target player mills two cards.

Card.Name: Jeweled Amulet
Card.RulesText: {1}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Jeweled Amulet. Note the type of mana spent to pay this activation cost. Activate only if there are no charge counters on Jeweled Amulet. {T}, Remove a charge counter from Jeweled Amulet: Add one mana of Jeweled Amulet's last noted type.

Card.Name: Madcap Experiment
Card.RulesText: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal an artifact card. Put that card onto the battlefield and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. Madcap Experiment deals damage to you equal to the number of cards revealed this way.

Card.Name: Scroll Rack
Card.RulesText: {1}, {T}: Exile any number of cards from your hand face down. Put that many cards from the top of your library into your hand. Then look at the exiled cards and put them on top of your library in any order.

Card.Name: Shield Sphere
Card.RulesText: Defender Whenever Shield Sphere blocks, put a -0/-1 counter on it.

Card.Name: Faithless Looting
Card.RulesText: Draw two cards, then discard two cards. Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

Card.Name: Trash for Treasure
Card.RulesText: As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact. Return target artifact card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

Card.Name: Great Furnace
Card.RulesText: {T}: Add {R}.

Card.Name: Pendelhaven
Card.RulesText: {T}: Add {G}. {T}: Target 1/1 creature gets +1/+2 until end of turn.

Card.Name: Field of Ruin
Card.RulesText: {T}: Add {C}. {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Field of Ruin: Destroy target nonbasic land an opponent controls. Each player searches their library for a basic land card, puts it onto the battlefield, then shuffles.

Card.Name: Darksteel Citadel
Card.RulesText: Indestructible {T}: Add {C}.

Card.Name: Mishra's Factory
Card.RulesText: {T}: Add {C}. {1}: Mishra's Factory becomes a 2/2 Assembly-Worker artifact creature until end of turn. It's still a land. {T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

Card.Name: Inkmoth Nexus
Card.RulesText: {T}: Add {C}. {1}: Inkmoth Nexus becomes a 1/1 Phyrexian Blinkmoth artifact creature with flying and infect until end of turn. It's still a land. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
